I'm not saying liking girls isn't a core part of being a lesbian.

I'm saying that being a lesbian isn't a core part of Neeko's character OVERALL.

If the single most defining thing about her is the fact that she likes girls and not something else like how she is part of an ancient race of beings from an unknown island, that's not good character design.

Besides, even if being a lesbian is somehow the single most important thing about Neeko, that doesn't mean she needs to mention it every time she's in the general vicinity of another female. That's obnoxious.

She has a specific line for Shyvana, Nami, Nidalee, Taliyah and Evelynn that shows attraction, with _maybe_ Illaoi as a distant sixth. I'm not counting Ahri because literally _everyone_ says that Ahri is beautiful at one point or another. She also mentions Xayah offhandedly. That's a specific 10 lines or so out of 100+. That still leaves:

none of whom she ever addresses in any fashion.

Liking girls _clearly_ isn't the most important thing about Neeko. Her first thought is always learning information about new places and people, as she's already clearly demonstrated. I think the fact that you focus on her sexuality being "too big a part of her character" is because, unlike other champs where it's only been hinted at, it's at the forefront where you can't ignore it.

I'm not going to bother saying any more than that, because you'll just move the goalposts a third time, and I'm getting quite tired of it. So thank you! And have a nice day.

I think most rational people don't inheretly dislike Neeko because she is lesbian, but because of the fact that people are focusing only about the fact that she is one. I mean, she is also a shapeshifter half-lizard!! A curious chameleon! I think her aspect of curiosity can make the younger audience coorelate with her, no matter who they are. But people (including Riot, to a degree) are putting her sexuality on a pedestal. Diversity is always nice, but for many, sexuality is rarely a part of their personality. I personally think It's always interesting when characters aren't defined by sexuality. And Neeko isn't that, she is just childish.  Though I do understand where people are coming from, it's nice to have representation. But this, for me borders on kindergarden.
